column4: Hmmm, so the guide I followed told me to blacklist the driver that Ubuntu installed for my wireless card. To unblacklist it, can I just comment out the line I added?
spent most of yesterday and this night getting my atheros to work ;P
in the end the only thing that worked was installing the .28 kernel and going from there
Upgrading the kernel? I'm a bit too much of a novice for that
simple task with the precompiled kernels, but yeah, well. couldn't get it to work otherwise myself.
some others have had more luck so i guess you might too
pray it appears in network manager ;P hehe
it should find it automatically if it is working correctly. unless using a hidden ssid.
This could be where I'm going wrong then - I've licked on the network symbol at the top right of the screen and have "Wired Network - Auto eth0" then "Wireless Networks" and no options to pick?
does it say anything at all under wireless? osomething about not being managed/controlled?
which method are you using for your driver now btw? madwifi, ndiswrapper or something else?
I have Wireless Networks as if it's a heading and then a divider then VPN Connections
Am I supposed to use madwifi? I was hoping that it'd work out of the box?
well, most people had to use it with pre-.28 kernels from what I read
